content.description:
start on small edges at the bottom of the crack and work your way to the top. use the large root to safetly mantle the lip. holds and feet get better as you go up. crux is 1-2 moves past the start.besides being an awesome climb the best part comes when you get to do a massive canon ball from 30' up. Note the route is not named canon ball derivative from the diving form but from the large water explosions during the top ledge cleaning

between simpson bay the power house past corn flakes and dark secrets
water is your spotter, super deep water all clear

start in the bottom corner and work your way up the face and back to the corner as it comes to a small roof, stretch or dyno for a pocket that may or may not exist under a tuft of grass and find some way to top out from there. has not been sent but is great to work on

at the north end of simpson bay just before it turns the corner
water is your spotter, at the bottom left corner is a rock outcropping , if you fall avoid this

crux comes as you go up and past the most vertical part of the first 1/3, continue past this on black granite bulges

directly left of the slab sport route
from the sport anchors go up and left to a set of higher anchors to set up this top rope, belay from the bottom of the sport route on its lowest hanger

belay from the bottom exposed hanger, work up the slab on cool black granite bulges. crux is 4th or 5th bolt where the rock is the most vertical.  

past power house on your way to glacier bay, cant miss the impressive slab that continues into the lake
9-12 hangers with 2 anchors for TR

crux is moving past the crack to the slab and the last bolt to the anchors is also very thin

just right of unicorn tream follow a crack up until it thins then head left as it meanders to a set of belay anchors
gear to 3 inch and 6 draws plus anchor

several bouldery deep water solo traverses, a few deep water solo vertical routes and some bolted slab as well.the rock is great granite but some areas, due to weathering, have extreme quartz crystals that provide great friction and finger print removal.good sun exposure but will get shady in late afternoon as it is east facing. Current routes were set at high water but the lake has the potential to drop another 30 feet which may enhance routes and problems or ruin there access/landing. time will tell. bring shoes that you dont mind getting wet. huge potential so bring a brush or two, super awesome summer time fun
